result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
19CF129:
Ct. 1 (Escape-Criminal Arrest)>> Sentence W/H- 5 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full Time Work/Full Time School or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Restitution in the amount of $1,683 (plus 10% Surcharge) (from case 22CF863) to be paid to B.K.- Restitution to be paid Joint and Several with E.S. and P.Y. Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 179 Days Credit.

INCLUDES 17CF1374, 19CF129, 19CF272, 19CF622, 19CF1100, 20CF1218, 21CF490, 22CF863, & 22CF879.

**WARRANT QUASHED**

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 22CF863 & 22CF879. 
Reading Waived.  
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $25,000 cash bond to cover all files - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): BGK,  MJC, JS, TP, or JRT. 
- No contact with co-defts: Porscha Young and Eric Slocum. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
BFH: 8/19/2022 at 9:00 am. 
RH: 7/27/2022 at 1pm in Courtroom B.  
Prelim: 8/1/2022 at 9:40 am in Courtroom B.

INCLUDES 17CF1374, 19CF129, 19CF272, 19CF622, 19CF1100, 20CF1218, 21CF490, 22CF863, & 22CF879.   No contact with victim(s): BGK, MJC, JS, TP, or JRT.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No contact with co-deft(s): Porscha Young and Eric Slocum.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
